page.title: 03Tourism in Yewdale
page.content: {Tourism}This has been an important part of the local economy since the days of the Lakes poets. Tourists are attracted by the rugged, glaciated scenery and this is found in our block in the form of U-shaped valleys {(Yewdale),}mountain peaks{(Wetherlam and{The Old Man)}and hanging valleys containing waterfalls, e.g. the{"White {Lady"}(306992). {Fell walking, climbing}and{fishing are the most popular activities followed by tourists. Accommodation for them is an important source of additional income to the farmers in our block, as well as the main income for the owners of guest houses, hotels and caravan sites that are to be found on the northern fringe of Coniston. The long distance footpath, the {"Cumbria Way"}passes through Yewdale, and is an additional attraction.
